data.title: Amy Winehouse a winner again at Ivor Novello Awards
data.meta_description: Amy Winehouse has won yet another award, this time for Best Song Musically And Lyrically for Love Is A Losing Game, at the annual Ivor Novello Awards.
data.text:
Amy Winehouse has won yet another award, this time for Best Song Musically And Lyrically, at the annual Ivor Novello Awards.

She had two out of the three nominations in the category, but won with Love Is A Losing Game.

However, despite being at the glitzy ceremony at London's Grosvenor House Hotel, she asked her cab-driver father Mitch to accept it on her behalf instead from soul singer Beverly Knight.

The Ivor Novellos are widely regarded as the Oscars of the songwriting world and are one of the most coveted awards for British artists.

The rest of the winners announced this afternoon were:

Best Selling British Song Beyonce & Shakira - Beautiful Liar

International Achievement Phil Collins

Best Contemporary Song Cherry Ghost - People Help The People

Best Television Soundtrack Oliver

Album Award Radiohead - In Rainbows

The Ivors Inspiration Award Jazzy B

PRS Most Performed Work Take That - Shine

Outstanding Sound Collection - Gabrielle

Best Original Film Score Atonement

Ivors Classical Music Award Jonathan Dove

PRS Outstanding Contribution to British Music Chris Difford & Glenn Tilbrook

Songwriter of the Year Mika

Special International Award Diane Warren
